intro: Astragalus diphacus, commonly known as the two-seeded milkvetch, is a member of the legume family Fabaceae. It is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, including parts of China, Mongolia, and Russia. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring compound leaves and small, yellowish to reddish flowers. Its pods contain two seeds, which is reflected in its scientific name. Astragalus diphacus is known for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
